docs.text:
TypedTables.jl


Simple, column-based storage for data analysis in Julia.




Introduction


TypedTables.jl
 provides two column-based storage containers: 
Table
 and 
FlexTable
, both of which represent an array of 
NamedTuple
s. This package is designed to be lightweight, easy-to-use and fast, and presents a very minimal new interface to learn.


Data manipulation is possible throught the tools built into Julia (such as 
map
, 
filter
, and 
reduce
) and those provide by 
SplitApplyCombine.jl
 (like 
group
 and 
innerjoin
). You can speed up data analysis tasks with acceleration indices, by using the 
AcceleratedArrays.jl
 package. This package is integrated the 
Tables.jl
 interface, and therefore the rest of the data ecosystem such as 
Query.jl
. This documentation includes examples on how to integrate with these packages for a complete data analysis workflow.




Contents

docs.text: TypedTables.jl  provides two column-based storage containers:  Table  and  FlexTable , both of which represent an array of  NamedTuple s. This package is designed to be lightweight, easy-to-use and fast, and presents a very minimal new interface to learn.  Data manipulation is possible throught the tools built into Julia (such as  map ,  filter , and  reduce ) and those provide by  SplitApplyCombine.jl  (like  group  and  innerjoin ). You can speed up data analysis tasks with acceleration indices, by using the  AcceleratedArrays.jl  package. This package is integrated the  Tables.jl  interface, and therefore the rest of the data ecosystem such as  Query.jl . This documentation includes examples on how to integrate with these packages for a complete data analysis workflow.
